cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (forecast to remain a tropical storm near Florida)
cyclone.current_location: about 260 miles E of the Windward Islands (near Barbados)
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly WNW across the eastern Caribbean, forecast to cross Jamaica and Cuba this weekend and emerge into the Florida Straits, then curve northward along or just west of the Florida Peninsula toward the eastern Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Cuba (crossing eastern-central Cuba late 4–5 July, then possible secondary landfall along the southwest Florida coast 6 July)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane/Tropical-storm watches now confined to Barbados, St. Lucia, St. Vincent & Grenadines, southern Hispaniola, Jamaica and parts of Cuba – none yet for Florida
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings for Barbados, St. Lucia, St. Vincent & Grenadines; Tropical-storm warnings Martinique, S coast of Hispaniola, entire Haiti
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Windward & Leeward Islands → southern Hispaniola → Jamaica → all of Cuba → Florida Keys / Florida Peninsula & eastern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible but not likely; expected rainfall generally 2–4 inches
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely on the Atlantic (PortMiami) side; greatest surge threat on Gulf side of Florida
weather_observation.wind: Outer bands could bring sustained 25–35 kt (30–40 mph) winds with higher gusts late Monday into early Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minimal on Biscayne Bay; 1–2 ft possible if the center passes just west, otherwise less
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could produce 2–4 inches locally, isolated heavier pockets
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadic waterspouts in rainbands; very rough seas and swell that may disrupt pilotage and cruise/containership schedules
